aws::graph::propositions: # Nokia Patent Infringement Complaints Against Amazon
Nokia Technologies Oy and related entities filed complaints against Amazon.com, Inc. and related entities beginning in October 2023.
The complaints allege infringement of patents related to video-related technologies.
The complaints were filed in multiple courts in the United States.
The complaints were filed in courts in India.
The complaints were filed in courts in the United Kingdom.
The complaints were filed in courts in Germany.
The complaints were filed in courts in Brazil.
The complaints were filed in the Unified Patent Court of the European Union.
The complaints were filed in the United States International Trade Commission.
Nokia Technologies Oy is a technology company.
Amazon.com, Inc. is an e-commerce and technology company.
The complaints allege that certain Amazon Prime Video services infringe Nokia's patents.
The complaints allege that features of Amazon devices carrying the Prime Video app infringe Nokia's patents.
Some of the complaints additionally allege infringement by Freevee.
Some of the complaints additionally allege infringement by Twitch.
Some of the complaints additionally allege infringement by Amazon voice assistants.
Freevee is an Amazon streaming service.
Twitch is an Amazon streaming platform.
The complaints seek injunctive relief.
Some complaints seek unspecified money damages.
Some complaints seek enhanced damages.
Some complaints seek attorneys' fees.
Some complaints seek costs.
Some complaints seek interest.
Some complaints seek declaratory relief.

/FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 7 â€” COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES/

text: Beginning in October 2023, Nokia Technologies Oy and related entities filed complaints alleging infringement of patents related to video-related technologies against Amazon.com, Inc. and related entities in multiple courts in the United States, India, the United Kingdom, Germany, and Brazil, the Unified Patent Court of the European Union, and the United States International Trade Commission. The complaints allege, among other things, that certain Amazon Prime Video services and features of Amazon devices carrying the Prime Video app infringe Nokiaâ€™s patents; some of the complaints additionally allege infringement by Freevee, Twitch, and Amazon voice assistants. The complaints seek, among other things, injunctive relief and, in some cases, unspecified money damages, enhanced damages, attorneysâ€™ fees, costs, interest, and declaratory relief.
